results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Pence, Mike;Trump, Donald J;Eastman, John C;Chesebro, Kenneth;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Lawyer Cited ‘Heated Fight’ Among Justices Over Election Suits
results.abstract: In an email weeks after the election, another lawyer advising the Trump campaign responded that the prospect of “‘wild’ chaos” on Jan. 6 could lead the Supreme Court to take up a case.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The pro-Trump lawyer John Eastman, left, and Rudolph W. Giuliani at a rally near the White House on Jan. 6, 2021. Mr. Eastman, who aided in the pressure campaign against Mr. Pence, later sought a pardon through Mr. Giuliani, according to testimony at the hearing.

results.title: Emma Thompson and the Challenge of Baring All Onscreen at 63
results.abstract: The actress made the choice to disrobe. Still, she says, it was the most difficult thing she’s ever done in her four-decade career.

media.caption: If “you want the iconography of the female body to change,” Emma Thompson said, “then you better be part of the change.”

results.byline: By Karen Zraick and Ana Ley
results.title: Man Dies After Getting Stuck Between N.Y.C. Subway Car and Platform
results.abstract: The M.T.A. said the man got stuck as he was exiting a train car and fell onto the tracks, contradicting an earlier account from the police who said his pants had gotten caught in the car’s doors.

media.caption: Passengers waited for an incoming subway train on Thursday at the Avenue M station in Midwood, Brooklyn. A man died there after getting caught between the platform and a train car, the M.T.A. said.

results.title: Flooding Chaos in Yellowstone, a Sign of Crises to Come
results.abstract: Record rainfall and mudslides forced closures just as tourism season ramped up. Virtually none of America’s national parks are untouched by extreme weather and climate change.

results.title: Herschel Walker Acknowledges Two More Children He Hadn’t Mentioned
results.abstract: Mr. Walker, the Republican nominee for Senate in Georgia, has often criticized absentee fathers. But this week it has emerged that in addition to a son he often talks about, he has three other children.

media.caption: Herschel Walker is running against Senator Raphael Warnock, a Democrat, in one of this year’s most pivotal Senate races.

results.abstract: Microsoft will be disabling IE and directing Windows users to its modern Edge web browser in coming months. The news inspired jokes, memes and even some fond memories.

results.title: Where Did the Black Death Begin? DNA Detectives Find a Key Clue.
results.abstract: By fishing shards of bacterial DNA from the teeth of bodies in a cemetery, researchers found the starting point for the plague that devastated Eurasia, they say.

media.caption: A 14th-century depiction of the Black Death on a fresco in the former Abbey of Saint-André-de-Lavaudieu, France.

results.abstract: The deaths of at least 13 children were associated with the Infant-to-Toddler or Newborn-to-Toddler rockers sold by the company. Congress had outlawed sleepers with an incline.
